intro: Popowia klainei var. lastoursvillensis, commonly known as the Lastoursvillensis popowia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its botanical features include hairy stems and capsules as its fruiting structures. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
